intro: Pilea portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican pilea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
